item.title: Report I-2024110036
item.description:
Report I-2024110036

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-21T12:39:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-09
  • City: MINNEAPOLIS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOO LINE RAILROAD COMPANY(DBA CANADIAN PACIFIC KANSAS CITY RAILROAD)
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 10/9/2024 at around 12:00, CPKC Hazmat was made aware by FRA Inspector Vincent Leishman that NATX 37675 had been found Ieaking from the bottom outlet valve secondary closure cap during a hazmat inspection. CPKC mobilized a railroad qualified response contractor to investigate and mitigate the release. Upon arrival, responders actuated the bottom outlet valve in an attempt to secure it prior to removing the bottom outlet valve(BOV) cap. While removing the BOV cap, responders discovered that it was less than tool tight. Additionally, responders noticed that Methanol was Ieaking past the bottom outlet ball and seal. A new gasket was installed in the BOV cap. The BOV cap was then secured tool tight, stopping the release. File Note: Item 19-the quantity released was estimated based on the best information available at the time of filing. This shipment was offered as a'bulk' shipment, aka one car load, therefore the exact amount offered in this package is not known to the carrier. This carrier does not have access to mass balance data which can exactly quantify this value.

item.title: Report I-2024110038
item.description:
Report I-2024110038

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-21T12:39:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-08
  • City: SAINT PAUL
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOO LINE RAILROAD COMPANY(DBA CANADIAN PACIFIC KANSAS CITY RAILROAD)
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 10/8/2024 at 12:15 PM, CPKC Hazmat became aware that residue SODIUM CHLORATE hopper car, OFOX 60804, was Ieaking while in the ST Paul, MN rail yard. A rail qualified response contractor was mobilized to investigate and mitigate the release. Upon arrival, OFOX 60804 was found to be Ieaking from the A end hopper on the left side at the bottom camlock cap fitting. The A end hopper was found to have less than 1/8 of a compartment of liquid and solid solution. OFOX 60804 was also found to be Ieaking from the B end hopper on the left side where the bottom of the hopper is fastened to the frame of the car. The B end hopper was found with over 1/2 of a compartment of liquid and solid solution. It appeared that the shipper failed to fully unload the hoppers before releasing the car into transportation. Estimated release from the A end hopper is 9 gallons. Estimated release from the B end hopper is 1 gallon. Responders stopped the release from the A end hopper by securing a nitrile glove over the camlock cap fitting and the loading/unloading line with duct tape and a tension strap. Containment was placed under the point of release emanating from the B end hopper and sealant was applied to the seam where the bottom of the hopper is fastened to the frame of the car to stop the leak. The source of the B end hopper release was.inside the hopper and could not be accessed. The contents of OFOX 60804 were transferred Into a tank truck, and then the hoppers were rinsed with water. The root defect was not determined for the A end bottom camlock cap fitting, though it was thought to have been attributable to a loose component. Likewise, the source of the release on the B end was not determined because it was not visible; however, due to the nature of the commodity moved in this specialized hopper car, it is likely to be attributable·to a failure in a weld or seam within the hopper. File Note: Item 19-the quantity released was estimated based on the best info,„iation available at the time of filing. This shipment was offered as a'bulk' shipment, aka one car load, therefore the exact amount offered in this package is not known to the carrier. This carrier does not have access to mass balance data which can exactly quantify this value.
